Strictly speaking, EBIT includes some nonoperating items, such as gains on
investment. The analyst, as with other ratios with various formulations, must
be consistent in his calculation method and know how published ratios are
calculated. Analysts should be concerned if this ratio is too low. Some analysts
prefer to calculate the operating profit margin by adding back depreciation and any
amortization expense to arrive at earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and
amortization (EBITDA).
